      Configuration edge

      2 minute read

      On this page

      Summary

      Configuration Edge Server. In this document, we will go without Edge subscription.

      Overall Design

      The public IP address is not displayed in the document.

      Procedure

      1. Edge Server preparation

      1. Changing hostname

      1. Change host name
      2. Click ‚ÄòMore‚Äô and add domain suffix
      3. Click ‚ÄòOK‚Äô and restart

        2. Proceeding installation

      4. Check Edge Transport role when you proceed installation
      5. The prerequisite is ‚Äò.NET Framework 4.8‚Äô and ‚ÄòVisual C++ 2012 Redistributable Package‚Äô.
      6. Click install
      7. Set up progress When the set up completed, you can check these two application are recented added

      3. Changing queue directory(Optional)

      1. Stop ‚ÄòMicrosoft Exchange Transport‚Äô

      2. Open this file using this command on the ‚Äòrun‚Äô 
        Notepad %ExchangeInstallPath%Bin\EdgeTransport.exe.config

      3. Change ‚ÄòQueueDatabasePath‚Äô, ‚ÄòQueueDatabaseLoggingPath‚Äô I recommend seperate this path as other drive.

      3.1 Create new disk if you need. 3.2 Enter the amount of space to shrink in MB 3.3 After shrink, allocate New Simple Volume 3.4 Assign drive letter properly 3.5 The new volum has been created

      1. Set the both path as ‚ÄòD:\Queue\QueueDB‚Äô As-Is To-Be
      2. Start ‚ÄòMicrosoft Exchange Transport‚Äô again
      3. The Queue DB location has changed

      4. Changing Log directory(Optional)

      1. Changing log directory ```shell #Exchange Î©îÏùº ÏÜ°ÏàòÏã† Log ÏúÑÏπò Î≥ÄÍ≤Ω $path= ‚ÄúD:\ExchangeLogs‚Äù

      #Transport Service Get-Transportservice|Set-TransportService -ConnectivityLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\Connectivity‚Äù -MessageTrackingLogPath ‚Äú$path\MessageTracking‚Äù -IrmLogPath ‚Äú$path\IRMLogs‚Äù -ActiveUserStatisticsLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\ActiveUsersStats‚Äù -ServerStatisticsLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\ServerStats‚Äù -ReceiveProtocolLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\ProtocolLog\SmtpReceive‚Äù -RoutingTableLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\Routing‚Äù-SendProtocolLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\ProtocolLog\SmtpSend‚Äù -QueueLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\QueueViewer‚Äù -WlmLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\WLM‚Äù -PipelineTracingPath ‚Äú$path\edge\PipelineTracing‚Äù -AgentLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\AgentLog‚Äù -DNSLogEnabled $true -DnsLogPath ‚Äú$path\edge\DNSLog‚Äù

      #ÏïîÏãúÏ†Å ÏÜ°Ïã† Ïª§ÎÑ•ÌÑ∞ Î°úÍ∑∏ ÌôúÏÑ±Ìôî Get-TransportService|Set-TransportService -IntraOrgConnectorProtocolLoggingLevel Verbose

      In the shell
![](https://velog.velcdn.com/images/leeyosebi/post/c427cf72-5058-4908-a9fa-fbdbc17a8c12/image.png)
2. After execute the command, you can check the '**ExchangeLogs**' in the 'D:\'
![](https://velog.velcdn.com/images/leeyosebi/post/9dd90abf-ab90-4236-ad42-655adfdcb153/image.png)


### 5. Specify the internal SMTP servers
```shell
Set-TransportConfig -InternalSMTPServers @{Add="<ip address1>","<ip address2>"...}

      6. Binding Public Certificate on the SMTP Service

      If you use public ssl certificate, you should bind the certificate on the SMTP service. Use following command on the Exchange management shell.

      Enable-ExchangeCertificate -Thumbprint <Thumbprint> -Services SMTP

      2. Set up Inbound flow on Edge

      Before we start though, we will configure ‚ÄòExternal ‚Üí Edge ‚Üí Exchange‚Äô

      1. Accepted Domain

      New-AcceptedDomain -Name whtpq.com -DomainName whtpq.com
      Now, the EDGE can receive from external mails regarding to ‚Äòwhtpq.com‚Äô domain
      Exteranl ‚Üí Edge

      2. Send Connector

      New-SendConnector -Name "To whtpq.com" -AddressSpaces whtpq.com -SmartHosts 10.10.4.41

      Now, the EDGE can send mails to the whtpq.com Exchange server(10.10.4.41)

      External ‚Üí Edge ‚Üí Exchange

      3. Set up Outbound flow on Edge

      We will configure this flow: Exchange ‚Üí Edge ‚Üí External

      1. Create Send Connector on the Exchange server side(Exchange ‚Üí Edge)

      1. Set the name and the type would be ‚ÄòCustom‚Äô
      2. Route mail through smart hosts(edge, 10.10.4.44)
      3. None for authentication
      4. Set the domain as *
      5. Add source server
      6. Disable other connector which route to the internet directly

        2. Create Receive Connector on the Edge server side(Exchange ‚Üí Edge)

      7. New receive connector 
        New-ReceiveConnector -Name "From whtpq.com" -Bindings 0.0.0.0:25  -RemoteIPRanges 10.10.4.41-10.10.4.42

      8. Add permission to the new receive connector 
        Get-ReceiveConnector -Identity "whtpqEDGE\From whtpq.com"|Add-ADPermission -User "NT AUTHORITY\ANONYMOUS LOGON" -ExtendedRights "Ms-Exch-SMTP-Accept-Any-Recipient"

        3. Create Send Connector on the Edge server side(Edge ‚Üí External)

      9. New send connector 
        New-SendConnector -Name "To External" -Internet -AddressSpaces *

      10. Logging send/receive connector(Oprional) 
        Get-ReceiveConnector|Set-ReceiveConnector -ProtocolLoggingLevel Verbose
Get-SendConnector|Set-SendConnector -ProtocolLoggingLevel Verbose

        4. Check the meesage header if it‚Äôs working or not

        1. whtpqsuperuser@whtpq.com ‚Üí leeyosebi@naver.com

      11. MessageTrackingLog
      12. Queue
      13. Message Header

      2. leeyosebi@naver.com ‚Üí whtpqsuperuser@whtpq.com

      Reference
